comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Amazing coincidence - or did someone at State Library NSW see this in the ANMM photostream? - [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons/7680447474/] It was the afternoon of Wednesday 10/05/1933, at Lyne Park, Rose Bay. The German team was from the 'Köln'. Details - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/16966131

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/statelibraryofnsw] Boo hoo! I can't get your link to work ... Sam Hood photographed another visiting German ship, the 'Magdalene Vinnen' which visited Sydney in March 1933, a couple of months earlier than this football game. Which may also be relevant to the German Embassy (Consulate?) photo. See comments and links here - [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons/6900315260/in/set-72157629416093106] And the amazing set - www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons/sets/72157629416093...

Imperial and swastika flags on the wall.
RW

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/statelibraryofnsw]RW [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons] Aha! I think we have the id of a couple of people in that Embassy / Consulate photo with the swastika on the wall - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/album/ItemViewer.aspx?itemid=823940&am... Captain Otto Schniewind is middle row sitting between two ladies with four stripes on his wrist. And the fellow standing second from right at the back is surely the same as the guy in the middle of this photo, of officers on the 'Köln' in May 1933 - [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons/7769590278/] Newspaper article from march 1933 about the flag change - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/16959672
